channel.title: Question about these "Security Precautions" on Whonix/VPN tutorial
channel.description:
Hello good people,
I was using VPN after TOR with ProxyVM using Firefox Browser in AppVM for some weeks and everything went good so far, but today I saw that Whonix updated their tutorial "Connecting to Tor before a VPN" and I saw some steps in "Security Precautions". So I want to ask some questions:
Are these steps necessary in my setup (AppVM with Firefox) ? Will these steps affect my fingerprinting on anon-whonix Tor browser ? Is this risky for my other Whonix VM's since I will change some Whonix system default settings ?
Can someone explain a bit please in a newbie way since I am having a bit trouble of understanding the importance of these steps. Thanks.

item.title: Question about these "Security Precautions" on Whonix/VPN tutorial
item.dc:creator: rojawe
item.source: Question about these "Security Precautions" on Whonix/VPN tutorial

item.title: Question about these "Security Precautions" on Whonix/VPN tutorial
item.dc:creator: rojawe
item.description:
Hello good people,

I was using VPN after TOR with ProxyVM using Firefox Browser in AppVM for some weeks and everything went good so far, but today I saw that Whonix updated their tutorial “Connecting to Tor before a VPN” and I saw some steps in “Security Precautions”.
So I want to ask some questions:

Are these steps necessary in my setup (AppVM with Firefox) ?
Will these steps affect my fingerprinting on anon-whonix Tor browser ?
Is this risky for my other Whonix VM’s since I will change some Whonix system default settings ?

Can someone explain a bit please in a newbie way since I am having a bit trouble of understanding the importance of these steps.
Thanks.
